gui

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gui.Circle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DraggableCircle

    public class Circle
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Graphics class Circle allows the drawing of circles. Circles use an (x1, y1, diameter) coordinate system of where they are located on the board. Each Circle is tied to and represents a BoardElement. Circles can be tied to instances of classes Node, Truck, and Parcel. While a Circle can technically be tied to an instance of class Edge, this option is not expected and may result in irregular behavior.
    Author:
    MPatashnik
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
